senses.sense_definition: To cause frozen food to become soft or liquid again by warming it.

examples.text: You should <w>defrost</w> the chicken thoroughly before you put it in the oven.
I usually <w>defrost</w> meat in the refrigerator overnight instead of using the microwave.

senses.sense_definition: To remove ice or frost from a surface, such as a refrigerator, freezer, or windshield.

examples.text: It took ten minutes to <w>defrost</w> the car windshield this morning.
We need to <w>defrost</w> the freezer because the ice buildup is reducing the space inside.

senses.sense_definition: To recover one's energy or composure after a stressful, cold, or tiring experience.

examples.text: After the long business trip, I need a quiet weekend to <w>defrost</w> and relax.
Give him a moment to <w>defrost</w> from the cold walk before you ask him any questions.

senses.sense_definition: The process of removing ice or frost, or a device setting designed to perform this function.

examples.text: Put the microwave on the <w>defrost</w> setting to thaw the bread quickly.
The rear window <w>defrost</w> in my car is broken, so I cannot see clearly when it snows.
